skill.name: analyzing-projects
skill.description: Analyzes codebases to understand structure, tech stack, patterns, and conventions. Use when onboarding to a new project, exploring unfamiliar code, or when asked "how does this work?" or "what's the architecture?"
skill.summary: Analyzes codebases to understand structure, tech stack, patterns, and conventions. Use when onboardi...
skill.author: CloudAI-X

security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill containing no executable code. All 54 static findings are FALSE POSITIVES caused by the scanner misinterpreting markdown syntax and template placeholders. The SKILL.md file contains only documentation, checklists, and example formatting - no actual shell commands, cryptographic algorithms, or network operations are present. The skill provides a structured workflow for codebase analysis.

content.value_statement: Understanding unfamiliar codebases takes significant time and effort. This skill provides a systematic 6-step approach to analyze project structure, identify technology stacks, and document architecture patterns for faster onboarding.
actual_capabilities: Detect technology stack from package files and dependencies
Map project structure with annotated directory trees
Identify architectural patterns and code conventions
Document development workflows and build commands
limitations: Analysis is read-only and requires manual command execution
Cannot analyze binary or compiled code directly
Accuracy depends on user providing correct file paths
Limited to visible project files and documentation

use_cases.title: Onboard to New Projects
use_cases.description: Quickly understand project structure, tech stack, and development workflow when joining a new codebase.

use_cases.title: Prepare for Code Reviews
use_cases.description: Analyze unfamiliar repositories before reviews to understand context and architectural decisions.

use_cases.title: Document Project Architecture
use_cases.description: Generate structured documentation for existing projects to help team members understand system design.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze this project structure and tell me what type of application this is, what technologies it uses, and how it is organized.

prompt_templates.title: Tech Stack Detection
prompt_templates.prompt: Look at the package files and configuration to identify all the technologies, frameworks, and tools this project uses.

prompt_templates.title: Architecture Overview
prompt_templates.prompt: Map out the high-level architecture of this project. Show me the main components, how they connect, and the overall design pattern.

prompt_templates.title: Development Workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Find and document all the development commands, build processes, testing setup, and deployment configuration for this project.

output_examples.input: Analyze this codebase and tell me what it does
output: RESTful API service for online store operations built with Node.js and Express.
Language: TypeScript, Framework: Express.js, Database: PostgreSQL with Prisma ORM
Authentication: JWT tokens, Testing: Jest with Supertest
Clean architecture with separation between controllers, services, and data access layers.
src/controllers: HTTP request handlers, src/services: Business logic, src/repositories: Database access

best_practices: Always start with README and documentation files for project context
Verify tech stack detection by checking multiple configuration files
Document assumptions and uncertainties in the analysis report
anti_patterns: Skipping the validation checklist reduces analysis accuracy
Making assumptions without evidence from the codebase
Ignoring configuration files that reveal important project details

faq.question: What types of projects can this analyze?
faq.answer: Works with any text-based codebase including web apps, APIs, libraries, and scripts in all major languages.

faq.question: How long does a typical analysis take?
faq.answer: Simple projects: 5-10 minutes. Complex applications: 20-30 minutes depending on size.

faq.question: Can it analyze private repositories?
faq.answer: Yes, if you have local access to the code. Works on any directory you can navigate to.

faq.question: What if the project uses uncommon technologies?
faq.answer: Identifies common patterns but flags unknown configurations for manual investigation.

faq.question: Does it modify any project files?
faq.answer: No, this is read-only analysis. It examines files and generates reports without changes.

faq.question: How detailed should the analysis be?
faq.answer: Follow the 6-step workflow for comprehensive results. Adjust depth based on your needs.
